result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J. Mence

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:39 p.m. Defendant Christopher J. Mence in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Christopher J. Mence in custody.  ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases: 16CM18, 15CM492, 16CM66, & 16CM17.
Court questions if the NGI pleas are withdrawn.
Atty Halverson states NGI pleas are withdrawn for these cases.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM18: No Contest
15CM492: No Contest
16CM66: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CM18, 15CM492, and 16CM66.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 16CM17 is dismissed & read in.

No victims present. ADA Constable reads a victim Impact statement.
ADA Constable makes sentencing recommendation to the Court. 
Atty Halverson concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION***

15CM492: I/S Sentence: 90 days jail with hube for work, counseling or any reason jail will allow, 1/2 on electronic monitor, if eligible,  37 days credit
18 mo Probation
Conditions:
Take all medication as prescribed and provide agent a list of those prescription. 
No contact with Melissa Mence, unless she and the Agent approves.
Participate in any other counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent.  
Provide DNA sample, if not already done so.
Pay costs, surcharges, including DNA surcharge.
Pay Restitution $107.80 to the Portage County Jail.

16CM18:  I/S Sentence: 90 days jail same jail conditions, consecutive to 15CM492
18 mo Probation, concurrent with 15CM492
Conditions:
Comply with same conditions as listed in 15CM492.
Pay costs, including DA surcharge. No DNA surcharge.

16CM66:  I/S Sentence: 90 days jail same conditions, consecutive to 15CM492 & 16CM18
18 mo Probation
Conditions:      
Comply with same conditions as listed in 15CM492.
Pay costs. No DNA surcharge.

original filed in 15CM492
Plea hearing on June 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 02-08-2016 09:00 am

Bond is set in 16CM17 and to cover 16CM18.
No contact with Melissa Mence or her residence.

Attorney Acalia N Halverson in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher J. Mence appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin. Cases 16CM17 and 16CM18 are both heard today for initial appearance.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
BTC: Amended Bond is set in 16CM17 and to cover 16CM18.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 01-25-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Christopher J. Mence appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant says he has not received his complaint and should be eligible for a public defender.  
Court requests someone from the public defender office to visit him to see if he is eligible.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

01-25-16: Amended Bond is set in 16CM17 and to cover 16CM18.
No contact with Melissa Mence or her residence.

DA Louis Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct-Domestic, Criminal Damage to Property.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
State requests a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  1/19/16  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2.
